node.name: FacingForward
node.author: Pixar
node.help: A function that computes the degree to which the normal of a surface faces the camera. You can use this function to fade the opacity of objects near the edges of your objects. Results range from -1 (facing away from camera) to 1 (facing toward the camera). Use the Abs and Clamp parameters to control result of the function.

property.name: Abs
property.help: Takes the absolute value of result. This means that surfaces that face away from the camera will be treated as though they face toward it.

property.name: Clamp
property.help: Clamps the result between 0 and 1. If the Abs parameter is disabled, all backfacing surfaces will result in black.

property.name: Invert
property.help: Performs an inversion of the results as defined by 1 - result. Behavior will vary with the setting of the Abs and Clamp parameters.

property.name: Attenuation
property.help: Controls the rate of falloff with angle.
